jparsec.ephem

Class Nutation

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.Nutation

  • public class Nutation
extends java.lang.Object
    Nutation in longitude and obliquity.

    This class performs nutation correction using IAU1980 theory of nutation or IAU2000A theory (with adjustments for IAU 2006 precession when necessary). The method can be selected by passing the adequate ID constant to the nutation calculation method, as it is done by using any of the calculation methods allowed by EphemerisElement. Otherwise, each of the methods can be directly called. See references in each method.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      • getNutationInLongitude

        public static double getNutationInLongitude()
        Returns the nutation in longitude.
        Returns:
        Nutation in longitude, in radians.

      • getNutationInObliquity

        public static double getNutationInObliquity()
        Returns the nutation in obliquity.
        Returns:
        Nutation in obliquity, in radians.

      • calcNutation

        public static double[] calcNutation(double T,
                    EphemerisElement eph)
                             throws JPARSECException
        Calculate nutation in longitude and obliquity. Results are saved in DataBase, using as identifier 'Nutation' for the array containing the values.
        Parameters:
        T - Julian centuries from J2000 epoch in dynamical time.
        eph - Ephemeris properties including if EOP correction should be applied and the ephem method selection: IAU2006/2009, IAU2000, or any other (for IAU1980 nutation).
        Returns:
        The two values calculated for nutation in longitude and in obliquity.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs accesing EOP files when required.

      • clearPreviousCalculation

        public static void clearPreviousCalculation()
        Clears previous calculation so that the next call to nutation calculation will be processed calling the algorithms instead of using previous calculated values to save time (if results are expected to be the same).

      • nutateInEquatorialCoordinates

        public static double[] nutateInEquatorialCoordinates(double jd_tt,
                                     EphemerisElement eph,
                                     double[] in,
                                     boolean meanToTrue)
                                              throws JPARSECException
        Nutates equatorial coordinates from mean dynamical equator and equinox of date to true equator and equinox, or the opposite. See AA Explanatory Supplement, page 114-115.
        Parameters:
        jd_tt - Julian day in TT.
        eph - Ephemeris properties.
        in - Input equatorial coordinates.
        meanToTrue - True to nutate from mean to true position, false for true to mean.
        Returns:
        Output equatorial coordinates.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case t is outside range a warning is thrown, and in case warnings should be treated as errors an exception will be thrown.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
